Reviews.Title: “good location, mediocre accomodations”
Reviews.Author: mkeith03
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here recently for 1 night after arriving on a late flight to SJU. Check in was quick and easy. The room was windowless and the bathroom floor was kind of dirty. (There was dirt and other people's hair under the sink/bathroom counter.) We were on the first floor and you could hear everything from the hall - footsteps, doors opening/closing, etc. Breakfast was good. I appreciated being able to make a waffle. I was annoyed that even though I pre-paid for the room, they wanted an extra $5 occupancy fee before I checked out. Also, the exit gate from their lot does not open automatically. You have to go inside and ask them to open it. My husband said that they had to use a mop handle to work the contraption that opened the gate. With a charge of $16/night for parking, you'd think they would be able to have a working gate. All things considered, the price was good and the location was good. I would likely not go back because I felt nickled and dimed, the room was not as clean as I would have liked, and it was too noisy.

Reviews.Title: “People are great”
Reviews.Author: CliffSTRONG
Reviews.Content: The Rooms are nice and in a good location for Old San Juan and shopping. Internet was not very good. The staff was very friendly and helpful, above all they are honest. I misplaced my camera and they found it and went out of their way to get it to me. Thankfully! I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok.”
Reviews.Author: brian61982
Reviews.Content: The smallest bathroom I've ever seen. Just an ok room. For the price you can do better. Front staff not overly friendly upon check in.

Reviews.Title: “met what we needed”
Reviews.Author: robinnit
Reviews.Content: The place needs some work, but all and all for the price it was hard to beat. It was relatively clean and the staff was very helpful. It was within walking distance to some nice shopping and resturants. Breakfast was fine. Next time i will bring my fishing rod as there were some tarpon rollng in the bay 1oo yards from the hote.l

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: elaine m
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location (surprisingly upscale neighborhood!), friendly staff, pretty good rooms. Recently renovated and just a stones throw from the beach. Honestly, for the price, you really cant ask for more. I was highly please and will definitely return. I come to San Juan often, and I think this is certainly one of the better budget hotel options in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort Inn - Book somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: Deborah A
Reviews.Content: Not a good hotel by any stretch of the imagination. Run down and overpriced for what you got. Crummy room, loud air conditioning, and VERY noisy halls because of the echoes of everything off the cement walls and floors. I have stayed in Choice Hotels (Sleep Inn, Comfort Inn) before, but this one is really not good. Embassy Suites and Hilton Carib got great reviews from fellow cruiseship passengers. Breakfast was good but didn't make up for lack of amenities. I've learned my lesson.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: rdj55901
Reviews.Content: OK location; front desk added a surcharge to our pre-paid choice hotel rate. No amenities in bathroom & a broken hair dryer & shower rod. Wi-fi signal worked, but it was not connected to the internet. The front desk suggested we try to sign on to the Holiday Inn WiFi whose signal reached us. The bed was the most worn mattress I have slept on with a major chain. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Cleaning staff is EXTREMELY LOUD every morning!!!”
Reviews.Author: StaceyMalibu
Reviews.Content: Looks good from the outside, good location but that's all! Yes it's cheap, but the rooms were much worse than I expected. I immediately wanted to check out but couldn't afford anything better. If you can, avoid this hotel and check the prices next door at the Holiday Inn Express which is under the same ownership. You will see just from comparing the lobbies that it's an upgrade. The man at the desk let me check out the rooms and I saw for myself that they were nicer and only about an additional $10-20/night. Most of the staff at front desk, at Comfort Inn were helpful, the women especially, but the cleaning staff were so loud every morning starting at 7am, shouting too eachother and sometimes singing to themselves. Every morning they would congregate to the cleaning room next to us. I don't know if it was just on the 3rd floor but it was so inconsiderate and ruined my travel plans! I finally asked them politely if they could be quiet but they just said okay, sorry and shrugged it off. They continued being loud once I returned to my room. Best of luck if you book here!

Reviews.Title: “Great visit, Great staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: BayviewManagement
Reviews.Content: I was staying in Rincon for a week and had to leave early from there and come back to San Juan for my flight. I had been driving for about 2 1/2 hours and was ready to just go to bed being that it was almost midnight. I found this hotel by chance and from the moment I pulled in, the staff was extremely friendly. The evening security helped with the parking and the rates were suprisingly reasonable. I had an issue with the safe in the room and the gentleman from maintenance came right up, I did not get his name but he couldn't have been more helpful. I would like to say though the one staff memeber that really stood out was David. He was workign the 3rd shift when I came in and as a hotel manager myself I can honestly say you are lucky to have him as a memeber of your team. He was so helpful and accommodating and made some wonderful recommendations for dinning. The hotel itself was in a great location and there is plenty of dinning within a very short walk. Thank you again to all of the staff for your help and I will return next year.

Reviews.Title: “poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: crisndeefromde
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night pre-cruise. The lobby looked nice and inviting. Big sign outside stating the parking charge for guests but we didn't have a vehicle. We arrived shortly after 12. We were told to "go get something to eat and by the time you are finished your room will be ready". Ok went to get something to eat and stopped at Walgreens and we were back at 215. "no sir...housekeeping hasn't brought a list of what is ready." Ok whatever. Housekeepers are standing behind this gentleman talking on cellphone. As more people pour in and are having their luggage stored as well because...."housekeeping hasn't brought the list" he seems to look down and says he will take the next person waiting. So it's us and he assigns us a smoking room on floor 4. We requested non-smoking. He says the person on the shift before him assigned all the rooms per request. Then people around us are mumbling as well. We have to wait for bags to come to us in lobby. Next four people come up and same issue. well half an hour later here comes our bags. We ride in the scary elevator up to our room. Very small and you can hear every word our next door neighbors are discussing as it an adjoining room. Geesh. Hotel is sold out so no options to move. Smells smokie also and I turned on the ac fan to help clear the air. We then left to go exploring. We got back much later in the evening and tried the internet and no luck either. So as the front desk says oh so sorry, we decide to turn on tv to drown out noise from next door. Ridiculous price for this. Next morning after very little rest we went down to breakfast. it was ok. The attendant wasn't very pleasant but whatever. Took forever to get down the elevators with our luggage. We got a cab right out front. So glad to being on a cruise. Adventure of the seas is our cruise ship. We weren't expecting the adventure to start checking into this hotel. Will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “It's ok for the money”
Reviews.Author: heart2go210
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at this Comfort Inn. It is not the newest or nicest hotel in San Jaun by any means but for the price it was ok. We needed a place to stay before we shipped out on our cruise and did not want to pay a lot of money. We stayed in a two bedroom suite. There was a fridge and microwave and a living room area that worked out really well for us. The beds were amazingly comfortable and we slept very well. The bathroom was a little ghetto and it was impossible to shower without water spilling out on the counter and floor. The furniture was also little dirty. But overall it worked out ok. The elevators are a little scary and need updating.. I was just waiting for them to get stuck between floors. The breakfast in the morning was pretty good. If you want a place to go swimming this is definitely not a place you want to stay. The pool is very small. The location is good as It is close to many restaurants and shops. It is also a short walk to the beach. The staff was helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort Inn, Condado area of San Juan, PR”
Reviews.Author: Susan C
Reviews.Content: This is not a good choice. I only wanted 2 things from my stay: sun by the pool, and internet in the room. The pool area is so small that the chairs don't even recline, and the area is in the shade all day because of the tall buildings all around it. And the internet only works in the lobby, even though they say it works in the rooms. Even for the price this is pretty disappointing - I thought there was sun everywhere in San Juan, but not here! The only redeeming feature is that the beach is only 2 blocks away (take $5 for a beach chair, though!) The price is right but nothing else is!

Reviews.Title: “Decent room for the money”
Reviews.Author: TravelinTami51
Reviews.Content: Staff was very helpful in getting us a great tour of the El Yunque rainforest. Rooms were very clean and breakfast was good.

Reviews.Title: “It was so great this time”
Reviews.Author: stevetraveling2pr
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Comfort Inn in San Juan was not nearly as good as a couple of years ago. The one elevator was scary. When I stepped into it, it went down a few inches and then was very jerky and noisy on the way up. The next day, they had hand written signs saying â€œDo Not Exceed 4 Peopleâ€�. That is not comforting to see, would if 4 large people get on there and how do they know to limit it is 4 and not 3 people? If it needs repair, close it down and get it fixed. My first night, I did not have hot water and I needed to shower to go out. I told the front desk and the next day, same thing. It ended up that the shower control was very touchy and had to be placed just right for the water to be hot. I am sure I was not the first to complain, so fix it. The worst was being rudely interrupted twice by the woman at the front desk. I had a question and before I could finish, she is cutting me off. Very rude and unacceptable. I believe the hotel is under new ownership or management, and they better figure it out or business is going to go down hill. Iâ€™ll give it one more try because I get free nights with Choice Privilege Points and they have smoking rooms. But if it is like these again, I am done.

Reviews.Title: “Serves the purpose”
Reviews.Author: Travelin_Bear
Reviews.Content: Our room was clean, which to us is the most important part. And the bed was comfortable. The location of the hotel is convenient to the hotels and casinos in the Condado area as well as to the bus line to Old San Juan. But overall, the hotel is a bit worn and pretty spartan. I'll assume that the problem with our room's air conditioner was a fluke. It's mounted high up in the wall, right above the flat-screen TV and and electrical outlet. No matter how low we'd set the temperature, the air conditioner would drip water onto the floor, furniture, and in the area around the outlet. No damage was done but it was a little unnerving. The continental breakfast is basic; really basic. We stayed two nights and it worked out OK for sightseeing one day and embarking on a cruise the next. If you're simply looking for a clean place to sleep, the Comfort Inn will do.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: IndyJen1
Reviews.Content: October 26-29, 2011. We chose this hotel based on price and Choice Reward points. It's about a block from the beach, which was beautiful. It is close to a bus stop, and down the street from two car rental agencies. Though we didn't spend much time in the Condado area, it felt safe and had plenty of restaurants and people out and about all the time. The room was awesome. There were three of us, and we were upgraded to the suite that had two rooms, each with a king-sized bed. Very very nice to have plenty of room to spread out. The morning breakfast was also sufficient and well-kept. We stayed there for three nights before our cruise and were quite pleased. The staff also was helpful. I don't care if it doesn't look like a brand new five-star hotel. It worked great for us.

Reviews.Title: “Old but cosy”
Reviews.Author: gadi_sam
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights in Comfort Inn, San Juan, in August 2011, after our cruise. It's an old hotel which has been renovated, but the signs of old age can still be seen everywhere. It really needs some serious facelift. However, we received a huge room, which turned to be very comfortable. Originally we booked a king-bed room, but their king-bed rooms have no windows, so we switched to a 2-doublebed room. They let us check in at 11am, which was very nice of them, and also at the departure day they let us stay in the room until 1:30pm. The good points: Very close to Condado strip. Bus stop to Old San Juan is within 3 minutes walk. Excellent front desk service. Breakfast fairly good. The bad points: An old facility. No fridge in the room. Internet connection worked on and off.

Reviews.Title: “Captain Scott USA”
Reviews.Author: captain s
Reviews.Content: The room was very Damp and the floor very dirty like the rest of the place is low end ran. spend your trip at the holiday inn just across the street. You will be Very happy you did. from you captain.

Reviews.Title: “Few blocks off main strip. Newly re-modeled.”
Reviews.Author: gulliver4u
Reviews.Content: The hotel lobby area had a total facelift and was quite cosmopolitan. Very nice staff. The parking was a pain. Once I got a spot, i left my rental car in it and walked everywhere. Well, at least to the Concado area. i drove downtown, of course. The rooms were quiet. Just off the main strip, behind Cartier.

Reviews.Title: “Left precious heirloom on sink....Never to be seen again!!”
Reviews.Author: Dissappointed2011
Reviews.Content: To make sure I have the correct Comfort Inn in San Juan the ph # is [--]. Four of us spent the night of April 24, 2011 there on our way to a 7 day cruise. The next day on the cruise my husband realized that he had left his ring (an heirloom that his deceased father left him) on the sink in the bathroom of our motel room. I got the motel's phone number from the desk on the ship and called. I told the gentleman on the phone what had happened and that we had reservations to return on 5-1-11 on our way back to the USA. He said he would pass info. along and save the ring for us. So we were shocked when we returned to the lady at the desk being very rude and saying nothing had been found and had no sympathy at all for our situation. She just said they could not be responsible for anything not left in their safe. When I asked to talk to the lady that cleaned the room, she was just very defensive and started speaking in spanish. (which for the first time in my life I wish that I could have understood) I realize it's our fault for leaving it but until this point I had felt safe at any other Comfort Inn I had stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “This place is definitely a great value.”
Reviews.Author: dasumner
Reviews.Content: The front desk person, Nora, makes this hotel worth twice the price. She was beyond helpful and very friendly. As for the facilities, it is an older building and there are some places where the age shows, but for the price it can't be beat. It was a one block walk to the beach and a 4 or 5 block walk to dozens of fun spots along Ashford. Parking is lacking. The rooms were clean and the maid service was very good. The bathroom equipment was fairly new and very clean. The pool was tiny but also very clean. Sure you could spend more for a fancier name, but I doubt that any other hotel's price/value point comes close.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for the price”
Reviews.Author: firebirdgirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel was surprisingly a good value. We had a large group staying at the hotel both prior to and after our wedding in Puerto Rico. The staff were, for the most part, very nice and helpful. A few times, they made weird comments, but overall ok. Parking ($10.00/day) is very very very limited to 11 cars per day, so make sure to check in as early as possible to get a parking pass. Otherwise, you will have to feed the parking meter every few hours or park in one of the lots within a few block radius for about $10.00-$15.00. Business center consists of 2 computer terminals which were always taken. Luckily, the hotel provides free wi-fi and we brought a netbook, so it all worked out. Beds and pillows were surprisingly comfortable. The pool looked very clean and pretty, although we never had a chance to use it. It looked like beach towels were provided for guests. The beach is one block away. Great shopping and restaurants line the main street nearby (Ashford Ave.), with one or two casinos also closeby. The highway exit to and from the airport is a few blocks away. The free continental breakfast was a great treat each morning - hot coffee, fresh bananas, hot hard boiled eggs, pastries, cereal, and hot waffles. Overall good value.

Reviews.Title: “Why bother with reservations if you can't have them honored.”
Reviews.Author: bcharbonneau
Reviews.Content: I made reservations In October 2010 for a king non-smoking room, through Orbitz at this hotel. I paid for a King non-smoking when I booked it. I flew 9 hours to get to Puerto Rico the day of my reservation. When I got there I was informed that the only room available was a room with 2 double beds. I'm 6' 2" and have been traveling all day and paid for a King. They told me I would have to take up the issue with Orbitz. So I called them right away and then they called the hotel, who told them (Orbitz) that they couldn't give me a price break or any other form of compenstation until they spoke with the manager, who wouldn't be in until Monday. This is Sat. night, and I'm leaving on a cruise Sunday. So I called Orbitz upon my return home. They in- turn called the hotel again and the manager told them that they offered me a smoking room, which was a total LIE, as I would have taken the king smoking for one night, not that big of a deal. But they straight out LIED to Orbitz and said they would not refund any of my bill for the inconvience. Orbitz then told me that they couldn't do anything for me either. So I ask you,....You book a room 4 months in advance, pay for it, then get there and are told by the clerk, "this happens all the time with Orbitz", then neither party will make it right. Why bother, I told Orbitz they would never get my business again and I would pass thay on to all my friends and co-workers who travel, as well as Comfort Inn. They are both worthless!

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: amynlarr
Reviews.Content: Not as advertised. No ocean view. Pool was the size of a postage stamp with 7 chairs. Front desk check in person was beyond rude. Stay at the Marriott or anyplace else.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - San Juan ***CLEAN***”
Reviews.Author: dlmyvette
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my sister for 2 nights. My sister and I did not have a car so we used a cab to take us from the hotel to Mall of the America's, it was $20, not bad at all. The hotel iteself was excellent, it was clean which is my biggest requirement, we stayed on the first floor. The room itself wasn't that big a deal, very BASIC, but it worked and its all we really needed. We tried the continental breakfast one day and it was good. The vending machines were not in working order but the staff helped us get bottle water when we asked. Also, there was a lot of noise in the hotel, partially because the floors are tiled so every time someone closed their door it was a LOUD bang. Nothing unbearable though. I would definitely recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and a good value”
Reviews.Author: KChanimal
Reviews.Content: We booked a five night stay here at the end of April for a wedding we were attending. Most of the other guests stayed at a nicer hotel down the street, but we were looking for a more budget-friendly option and found it at the Comfort Inn. The room was clean and there was enough room for both of our large suitcases as well as for us to spread out. The bathroom needs some updating, but for the most part was clean. The a/c worked, but the room smelled a bit musty, but it would go away when we turned the a/c on. The free breakfast each morning is a huge bonus. In addition to your usual cereal, oatmeal, pastries and coffee, there are also hard boiled eggs and a waffle iron. The hotel is within walking distance to nicer hotels where you are able to access several beaches. There's also free wireless internet. I spent a bit of time by the pool, which was clean and cool. We were also able to park our car in the lot right in front of the lobby for $10/day. There is easy street parking nearby, but most of it is metered, which goes from 8am - 12am, so it's worth it to pay for parking, which includes in and out privileges. I would suggest calling ahead to the hotel to reserve a spot if you plan on parking, since all of the spots were full the first day we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Ritz, but fine for a night”
Reviews.Author: carterc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Comfort Inn one night prior to leaving on a cruise. We were traveling with 11 friends and had booked 3 rooms (2 rooms with 4 people, 1 with 3 people.) We arrived after 11:00 p.m. and check in was quick. The 2 4-people rooms were upstairs and commented on how slow the elevators were. The 3rd room was on the main floor and wanted us to sleep 3 adults in 1 king bed. After we refused, the clerk offered to bring in a cot, which he did quickly. (We had purchased the rooms on travelocity before and had to pay extra for each person.) The room on the main floor must have been some sort of closet that was remodeled because there were no windows. There was a large walk-in closet though! Breakfast is nice with fresh waffles and made-to order eggs. And it's very close to nice shopping and the beach. We pretty much slept and ate breakfast here then left. Overall I would stay here again for 1 night but not for an extended vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced for the quality”
Reviews.Author: LuisaTeacher
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 adults and an infant stayed in 2 rooms for one night before our departure on the cruise ship Carnival Victory. The counter staff was friendly and checked us in about an hour early. The sign behind the counter said they didn't accept debit cards, even though I booked it through "bookit.com" with the debit card. I did not have a credit card and the clerk told me they would have to debit the amount immediately. I told her that that was no problem... I was then charged an extra $10 to park our rental van. The overhead light in the room made such a loud noise that we couldn't hear the TV, which even though it was a nice flat screen, the image was very fuzzy.The tiny bathroom shower was ok but the fan did not work and there was no counter space. Pillows were very comfortable...it was a good night's sleep. In the morning we returned our rental van to the airport and paid a taxi $20 to return. (We learned to ask about fares before getting in) The hotel provided a continental breakfast that our grown son said was simple but sufficient. At checkout, the line was out the door and it took us nearly a half-hour to depart. The hotel staff offered to keep our luggage in a back room until we wanted to board the cruise ship, but I had checked with the ship earlier and was told we could drop it off at 2:30. We thought it better to take our luggage upon check-out and not pay the $25 taxi fare to return later. We have stayed in hotels all over the world and this hotel was definitely overpriced for what we received.

Reviews.Title: “Lobby is like walking in sauna, makes you...”
Reviews.Author: Deforhire
Reviews.Content: Lobby is like walking in sauna, makes you pay $2 for use of the safe. Has sign on counter, which says no early check-INS

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Will Stay Again.”
Reviews.Author: travel920
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night before our cruise. Good location. Nice Staff. Clean rooms. Comfort Inn Web-site states there are restaurants attached to the hotel, but they have both closed. There is however other restaurants within walking distance. Very nice area. Felt safe walking at night. Close to bars, restaurants, casinos. A taxi to just about anywhere is $15-$20. However if you are patient you can take the bus for $0.75. A taxi is very easy to find, there are usually several parked outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: Sept16
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Comfort Inn for one night, before embarking on a cruise out of San Juan. We were expecting adequate accomodations and were surprised to find the place has been recently refurbished--paint, bedding, etc. The continental breakfast was more extensive than usual, with self-made waffles and hard boiled eggs in addition to coffee, cereal, juices, etc. The next morning we we discovered that the beach is a much shorter walk away than the hotel's description might suggest and the area itself if fairly upscale in terms of shops. Overall, a nice experience and would definitely stay again when we're in San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable at Comfort Inn”
Reviews.Author: BarbadosMissy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Comfort Inn for 3 nts last week and it was very clean, right in the tourist area and we had a very pleasant stay. Continental breakfast was adequate - juice, tea, coffee, cereal, make your own waffles, toast, pastries,boiled eggs. Room was nicely furnished, beds were comfortable and Reception was pleasant and helpful. As for the Condado area, plenty restaurants, bars and if you like the big name stores like Louis Vuitton, Gucci etc. are right around the corner. A 24 hr Walgreens is about a block away. If you want to go further afield, take one of the plenty taxis near the hotel. Forget the bus...they seem to have no set schedule.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms for a good price!”
Reviews.Author: Garfield077
Reviews.Content: We stood a week in Puerto Rico to do some shopping and sightseeing. We live on a small island close to St. Martin and were really surprised by the friendly locals in Puerto Rico. Everybody was very helpful, even the people living on the street had good advices for us about the bus connections and how you can safe money rather than taking the taxi. I have never met so many friendly people as on Puerto Rico. The hotel is for its price a good deal and the rooms are very nice. We had a room with new furnitures, a flatscreen TV and an awesome bed. The hotel is in walking distance to the beach, although I wouldn't stay in that area if you are looking for a beach vacation. We stood there because we wanted to be in the center and do our shopping and explore some nice restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Cheap, Nice breakfast and wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: evac93rd
Reviews.Content: The hotel was being renovated while we were there and we had butcher paper for curtains the first night. The next day we had brand new curtains. We didn't get our reserved king-sized bed but Nora at the Front desk explained the King Rooms were on floors currently being renovated. The Hotel "comped" us our in room safes and I got to use the business center's high-speed internet w/o charge for our entire stay. It seems that these things are not automatically free in San Juan. All of the staff we nice but Nora and Walter were super. We got some great recommendations about places to eat and how to use the public transit system from them. The breakfast was great, the pool is fantastic, the rooms while a little run down were in line for renovation later in the year and were kept clean as a whistle. The location is near the beach, shopping, casinos, restaurants and 2 blocks from the $0.75 bus to old San Juan. If you are looking for Ocean views and luxury...then this is not the place for you. If you want a clean room with a good air conditioner, friendly staff and a great location at a great price, they stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Super-cheap, clean and decently located”
Reviews.Author: Budget_Traveler_007
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with this hotel, particularly after some of the negative reviews. Two nights was under $200, which is almost unheard of in Condado. It is located in a very posh and quite area. 5 minutes to the beach and restaurants and stores (stores such as Versace, Gucci, etc). You have to drive to Old San Juan (or cab), but other than that I have no complaints about the location. The rooms were clean and well-kept, floors were clean tile. Management was pleasant and helpful and area was quiet. Breakfast was free, and great. My only complaint is they charge your per person. So if you are trying to stuff 12 people in a room... might want to stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “If you HAVE to stay here, then do. If not, DON'T !!!”
Reviews.Author: Skipandnorine
Reviews.Content: This hotel is marginal at best for no more than a one-night stay, perhaps before or after a cruise (or until you find something better). Although the staff was nice, one doesn't pay to rent the staff. The beds are not comfortable, the rooms are small, the elevator is old, tiny and slow and (like most other places in downtown San Juan), the parking is atrocious. LOOK CAREFULLY AT THE PHOTO and you will see that there are only 5 (yes, FIVE) parking spaces in the hotel's "parking lot". Considering that these spaces are used by staff AND guests and that the hotel charges $10 per day for guest parking, you might begin to get the idea. Also, the owner of this hotel is ALSO the owner of the Holiday Inn Express (which is right next door), and sometimes the staff of THAT hotal park there as well......get the picture now? You'll be parking and walking alot.

Reviews.Title: “Practical, Location OK, Pay For What You Get”
Reviews.Author: corrineski
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location if you are leaving for a cruise the following day, which is what we did. I wouldn't stay here, though, for another reason. The room was just ok, very tight. It seemed clean enough, but it could have been better. It seemed like it was family run with only a husband and wife ever behind the desk. It took us some time to check in. The free breakfast is ok. You can take a cab into Old San Juan for a reasonable price and the location made getting to the cruise dock a breeze. There is also a bus line only a few blocks from the hotel that we were never able to figure out. It is quite congested in the area, I can't imagine bringing a car. Taxis were waiting outside 24 hours a day. Customer Service I'd give a B. Stay here for the low price and good location, but if you are looking for a high end hotel with all the bells and whistles, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for before and after a cruise”
Reviews.Author: hate2stayhome
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the night before we boarded a cruise and the night after and did some sightseeing in San Juan. The Hotel is in a crowded area and was under construction, but the rooms were clean and the staff was friendly and helpful. The breakfast was average. The location was close to a nice public beach and plenty of places to eat. The boxes of tiles stacked in the hallway outside our room indicated that more work was planned, but they were still untouched a week later when we returned. We thought they could be stacked elsewhere. One of the elevators didn't match the level of the floors when it stopped... too high or too low... not consistent. Would not recommend for a long stay but was fine for stop overs.

Reviews.Title: “Not Very Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Philly_Dan
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights and got a room with two beds. I was traveling with my wife, 2 children and an infant. Check in was pretty easy and they provide me quickly with a crib. Got an interior room with a view to the hallway. There was plenty of space in the room and was very clean. (Might be an idea if you are traveling with a lots of people). Pool was not very kid friendly though. It started out a 5 feet and ended up at 8 feet. Kids couldn't use it. I slept great but my wife found the bed to be to hard and woke up both days with a backache. (She has never complain before). Parking is awlful both on the street and on the hotel property. The hotel has about eight tight parking spaces. Parking is $10.70 (including tax) a night. You may have to leave your key if you end up blocking some other car. The greatest part of the trip was breakfast but that is typical with Choice Hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, large rooms”
Reviews.Author: Tigerfishing
Reviews.Content: We had two adults and two grown children. The accomodations worked for us because there were two separate bedrooms that were very large. One of the rooms had two queen beds which is exactly what we needed for our children. The living room was also very large - a sofa and a loveseat. There was also a separate kitchen area that had a pass through to the living room. The kitchen had a full-size refrigerator, sink and a microwave. The negatives were: (1) there was only one bathroom and the only way to access it was to go through our bedroom, and (2) the rooms smelled musty. I don't have a good sense of smell so I couldn't detect the musty smell, but my husband could. I think the place offered very good value for the price. The rooms were very clean and the pool was very nice. The location is conveniently located to shops, the beach and restaurants. We highly recommend the Di Parma Tratorria restaurant at 1049 Ave Ashford. It's outdoor dining at reasonable prices, particularly at lunch time.

Reviews.Title: “ok for the money!”
Reviews.Author: bjsmith19
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, room clean and comfortable for the money. Most other hotels were well into the 2-3 hundreds. We just wanted to sleep. Pool small, continental breakfast good. It's actually better than the pictures look.

Reviews.Title: “Worse Comfort Inn I ever stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: MS_TINA_5
Reviews.Content: My party stayed at this Comfort Inn on the 4th night of our 13-day trip. This was our 3rd hotel in Puerto Rico and unfortunately the worse hotel of our entire trip. I did not want to spend alot of money on this particular part of the trip (but I did any way), as we were going to be embarking on our cruise ship the next day. When I began looking to book a hotel, I realized that all hotels within San Juan and the vicinity are very expensive. The Choice Hotel chain should be very embarrassed that this hotel is part of their chain! However, they did provide a decent breakfast. The elevator scared me so I took the stairs, but, the stairs were very unstable. The person who checked me in was dealing with a problem with a guest and kept rolling his eyes as if the guest was expecting too much. Don't know what the conversation was but thought to myself that if I were calling I would not like to be treated like that. The pool was not at all attractive so I skipped that and walked down to the beach which was about 2 blocks away. I could not believe that an additional $10/day charge to park your car in one of their 4 spots was ridiculous. Fortunately, I was on my way to return the car to the rental facillity, therefore eluded the parking fee. There is no scenic view from any room in any direction, just views of dirty alleys and vacant buildings. In summary, if you are looking for just a bed to sleep in overnight, this is the place but expect to pay 3 times more for this budget motel.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we were looking for”
Reviews.Author: LastMango
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for 2 nights prior to a cruise. Based on reviews here on tripadvisor, we were expecting exactly what we got. The hotel is clean but old. Rooms were large. As we weren't planning on spending a lot of time in the room, we just needed a clean place with a decent bed. That's exactly what we got. Brenda on the front desk was very helpful. Made good recommendations for places to eat and assisted with the airline who had lost some luggage. Good location as the hotel is withing walking distance of beach, shopping and restaurants. Breakfast was typical Comfort Inn fare.

Reviews.Title: “Not Great - but ok”
Reviews.Author: OldYooper
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2 nights pre-cruise. Hotel is not in tip-top shape but it's not exactly run-down either. Our room was ok, carpet was somewhat worn, could be re-painted, beds were ok and bathroom was ok. Breakfast was good - ok, well... typical. There was a good selection of restaurants within 2 or 3 blocks. Beach was down a short street (Holiday Inn Express was there) and across a park. Beach was beautiful. Parking at hotel was nearly non-existant - I counted like 12 or 14 spaces! unless they have more parking somewhere else. But that was ok, because we took cabs to and from. There was a pharmacy and C-store nearby and Sunday morning we walked about 4 blocks to a catholic church for mass (in english) before our cruise. Would I recommend or stay again, hmmmm. I'd be tempted to try the Holiday Inn Express across the street (well sort-of) but I've read some not so hot reviews about that one too. So on balance, because this was just a pit-stop, I'd recommend it as such for the budget minded.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel w/ Small Bathroom”
Reviews.Author: JustMy0pini0n
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for one overnight stay and had other family members here and at another hotel nearby. I stayed in a room with double beds and a small bathroom. The bathroom was pretty small but compared to another hotel I seen that family stayed in this was like staying in the double tree. Their room was so small you couldn't do anything but laugh when they first opened the door. My niece had to get in the closet to let her husband walk by in the pathway to go the restroom at this other hotel. So yes if your going to stay this is a decent hotel near the shuttle that will take you into the downtown section of San Juan. The lobby only had one person working and they took forever to check people out which created a line. This hotel also does continental breakfast. The computer that has internet does not have a printer hooked up to it.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: horatiotripmaster
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnite before a cruise. Upon arrival there is a definite musty odor in the reception area that carried over to the room. Our travelling companions slept the night with their window open and the air conditioning off to avoid the dankness but only managed to be warm. Their toilet stopped up during the night, not at our friends' fault. It was cheerfully fixed in the morning but needless to say detracted from the experience. There was no adjustment offered. The best part was the staff who were quite pleasant and responsive throughout our visit. Breakfast was continental, not full. If we were to repeat we would have booked through Princess line at the Sheration. We were told by a fellow cruiser that she had obtained a large room with balcony with transfer from the airport and transfer to the ship for $169 all in. I paid $142 (with tax) for the Comfort Inn room (there is a lot of tax) and another $20+ for our share of cabs and got considerably less in comfort and convenience. We had lunch at the Sheraton on the way home and it was beautiful and would have been vastly more convenient, particularly for access to Old San Juan and of course, the ship..

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: jimmynliz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a weekend prior to our cruise. I was a little weary of the way the hotel looked on the website but we were pleasantly surprised. All of the attendants at the desk were extremely helpful with directions and with anything we needed, especially Nora-she was wonderful. Our room was much larger than we expected and for four people we couldn't have asked for a better room. It is newly remodeled and the upgrades show. The only not really negative but downside to the place was parking is very limited on the street, always very crowded so it was well worth it to pay the $10 a night parking to stay inside the little parking area in front of the hotel. When I say little I mean very little. Also the elevators were extremely small and were not redone, looked very old compared to the remodeled hotel. The contintenal breakfast was my only other complaint- not very many choices but I guess that is to be expected with continental. Overall we enjoyed our stay and were very pleased with everything. Felt very safe and enjoyed our stay. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed after reading other reviews -- dirty room, poor service”
Reviews.Author: Kitty_San
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading the other Tripadvisor reviews, but were majorly disappointed once we arrived. First off, there was no one at reception when we arrived and my husband had to walk around the hotel before finding a staff member. Second, our room was stuffy and smelled like no one had opened the windows for a while; there were large patches of black mold growing in two different areas on the ceiling; and the rug was dirty and had paint chips all over it (probably from decaying paint that had fallen from the ceiling). Third, we had a rental car with us and their parking system was inane -- the gates are not automatic and are raised only when the receptionist happens to see your car in her security monitor. One time, we said bye to the receptionist, who knew we had a car parked there, and she didn't bother raising the gate for us. That meant walking back in and telling her to raise the gate. This receptionist was also extremely surly and gave us commands accompanied by cold looks, rather than talking to us like a regular human being. Their complimentary breakfast was okay and the water pressure in the shower was good...those are the only somewhat-positive things I can think of about this place. I'd rather spend the extra $50 next time and stay at the Holiday Inn Express, which is right next door and looked ten times better.

Reviews.Title: “My new S.J. HQ!”
Reviews.Author: albertiger
Reviews.Content: Based on reviews here i took a chance after a bad stay in another hotel last time and was i ever happy. Greatlocation for shopping and restaurants in Condado and very close to cruise ship piers. A/C was great, my 6th floor room had a partial view of the ocean, and best of all its not directly on Ashford Ave. which is VERY noisy. Great staff tooOnly downside is the pool is in a tight little spot and gets very hot but the beach is just a block away! Will return again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and price”
Reviews.Author: Caribe-2
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a "suite" which consisted of 2 bedrooms with a living room in between. One bedroom was next to the kitchenette and bathroom and had 1 queen bed. The other bedroom had 2 queen beds. The rooms were clean--but dark---windows faced other hotels. The living room coffee table was too large for the room and was glass--so we had to be very careful when walking by with our luggage. The breakfast was nice--plenty of food and drink--but the room was very small. It was hard to get to the food as the tables were very close. The desk clerk in the morning locked up our luggage so we could explore before getting on our ship after lunch. We walked down to Tony Roma's for dinner---did not feel unsafe, but did see three police officers on our way. We did not see the pool. This hotel is nice enough--and the price is right. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort Inn Condado”
Reviews.Author: lorilorilori
Reviews.Content: This hotel is worth every penny. You are walking distance to the beach, shopping and very very good food. This is my favorite neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “very good value and great location”
Reviews.Author: dancingLinda
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one block from the main street where there are restaurants, shops and even a beach. It's worth the $$ and the breakfast is just enough to get your day going. The staff was friendly and helpful and even drew a map for us so we wouldn't get lost! I would definately stay in this hotel again - -

HotelInfo.Name: Comfort Inn
HotelInfo.Address: Calle Clemenceau 6 | Condado, San Juan 00907, Puerto Rico
